newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midcontinent Group Three diesel diffs ease.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midcontinent Group Three diesel diffs ease.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent Chicago diesel fuel differentials eased Friday as rainy weather in recent days lowered spot agricultural demand, traders said.
"Agricultural demand slowed down quite a bit," a trader in the U.S. Gulf said, attributing the sluggish demand to recent rainy weather.

Chicago low sulphur diesel for prompt delivery was talked 3.50 to 3.75 cents a gallon over the NYMEX May heating oil, or 0.25 cents lower than Thursday. Low sulphur for later timings was priced the same.

Group Three low sulphur differentials ended the day flat at 5.50/5.75 cents a gallon over the print, after rising to around 6.25/6.50 cents on news that a major Canadian pipeline, the Interprovincial, shut four lines briefly on Friday.

"That created a little excitment," a trader said, noting that unconfirmed rumors of refinery problems at Amoco's Texas City, refinery and Tosco's Bayway refinery in New Jersey, had operational problems.
Chicago unleaded was bid up 0.25 cents a gallon, to 0.50 cent a gallon over the print, with premium barrels edging up 0.25 cents a gallon to 0.50 cents a gallon higher.
